questions.text: All are true about double blind clinical drug trial, EXCEPT ?

options.label: B
options.text: It removes patient and investigator bias

options.label: C
options.text: The patients do not know which treatment they are receiving

questions.correct_answer: A. Each patient receives a placebo

questions.text: A 69-year-old woman complains of a throbbing headache, and presents with increasing difficulty in combing her hair, causing pain over the scalp and jaw pain while eating. She was diagnosed with polymyalgia rheumatica a year ago. A provisional diagnosis of giant cell arteritis is made. Which of the following blood values will increase in this condition?
All of the following are characteristics of causal association, EXCEPT ?
All of the following are an absolute contraindication for OCP, EXCEPT ?
Mass treatment is to control which one of the following disease ?
All of the following deals with Demographic processes, EXCEPT ?
Which of the following strain is used for varicella vaccine?
questions.explanation:
VACCINE STRAIN
BCG Danish 1331 [derived from M.bovis]
OPV P1, P2, P3 [bivalent- P1, P3]
Measles Edmonston zagreb, schwarez, Moraten
Mumps Jeryll Lynn
Rubella RA 27/3
Yellow fever 17D
Varicella Oka
H1N1 A7/ California/2009
Rabies fixed viral strain
Anthrax Sterne strain
Anti-malarial Litic cocktail [spf 66]
Mosquirix RTS,S
Anti-HIV MVA[Modified Vaccinia Ankara]

questions.text: A female student presents to the ER after a fall from a ledge approximately 1.5 m high while walking home. She has been drinking heavily and her friends report that she is now drowsier following her fall. She opens her eyes when her name is called and starts talking about her assignments for college. She winces when her nail bed is pressed. Her score according to the Glasgow Coma Scale will be:
questions.explanation:
Feature Response Score
Best eye response Open spontaneously 4
Open to verbal command 3
Open to pain 2
No eye opening 1
Best verbal response Orientated 5
Confused 4
Inappropriate words 3
Incomprehensible sounds 2
No verbal response 1
Best motor response Obeys commands 6
Localising pain 5
Withdrawal from pain 4
Flexion to pain 3
Extension to pain 2
No motor response 1

questions.text: Multiple exposures can be studied together in?
A 28 year old lady delivered a healthy baby by caesarean section at hospital. Breastfeeding should be initiated within ?

A perimenopausal woman presented with a 4-week history of greenish discharge from her right nipple. On examination, the right nipple appears to have a ‘slit-like’ appearance and is retracted and non-tender. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The most common cause of late Neonatal mortality in India is ?
Multiple duodenal ulcers that are not amenable to conventional medical therapy is associated with which of the following syndromes?
Daily total iodine requirement during lactation ?

A 56-year-old lady is having a total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease. During a thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease, a 55 year old patient develops a thyroid storm and tachycardia. Which of the following is a feature not likely to be associated with thyroid storm?
Remote contamination of water is indicated by ?
What is the Sound level above which tympanic membrane ruptures ?
All of the following Anti-tubercular drug can be given safely during Pregnancy, EXCEPT ?
The variables that is measured on the Nominal scale is ?
questions.explanation:
Nominal scale Ordinal scale Metric scale
Definition Based on NOM (names); no specific order Based on ORD (order); grading into categories Based on ME (measurement); in terms of quantities
Examples Race, Religion, Country of birth, Clinical features, Sites of lymphadenopathy, Sex of child, Type of anemia, ABO blood group, Site of malignancy TNM staging (cancers) ,Severity of a disease, Social classes Blood glucose, Hemoglobin level, Serum cholesterol, Weight, Height, Mid-arm circumference ,Blood pressure, Pulse rate, Temperature (°C, °F, K) scale

questions.text: All of the following is included in Population statistics in a population, EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
Population statistics Vital statistics

Population size

Sex ratio

Density of population

Dependency ratio

Birth rate, death rate

Natural growth rate

Life expectancy at birth

Mortality rates

Fertility rates

questions.text: All of the following can be the cause of Permanent hardness of water, EXCEPT :

After a workplace injury caused a severed arm, a 30 year old patient is admitted, with his airway patent and no difficulties in breathing. Pulse: 112 beats/min, blood pressure: 132/108 mmHg, respiratory rate: 25 breaths/min. Which stage of shock is this particular patient in?
questions.explanation:
I II III IV
Blood loss (ml) Upto 750 ml 750-1500 1500-2000 > 2000
Blood loss (% blood volume) Upto 15 15 - 30 30-40 > 40
Pulse rate (per min) < 100 100 - 120 120-140 > 140
Systolic blood pressure Normal Normal Decreased Decreased
Pulse pressure Normal or increased Decreased Decreased Decreased
Resp. rate (per min) 14 - 20 20-30 30-40 > 35
Urine output (ml/h) > 30 20 - 30 5 -15 Negligible
CNS/ Mental status Slightly anxious Mildly anxious Anxious, confused Confused, lethargic
Skin and capillary refill Normal < 2 s > 2s, clammy skin > 3 s, cool, pale skin > 3 s, cold mottled skin

questions.text: A patient presented to the ER with jaundice. On investigation, his stool appears to be pale; urine is dark red in color. This patient also has a palpable gallbladder. Which of the following is the most likely cause for this patient's symptoms?

options.label: B
options.text: Tumour of the head of pancreas

questions.correct_answer: B. Tumour of the head of pancreas

questions.text: Corneal transparency is due to ?
Inflammatory bowel disease does NOT have which one of the following as a systemic manifestation?
Inverse stretch reflex in muscle is mediated by ?
From the list of options below which one is the most unlikely cause of mechanical intestinal obstruction?
Vitamin K is essential for adding carboxyl group to glutamic acid residues on all of the following clotting factors, EXCEPT ?
The ankle brachial pressure index of a patient is measured during a peripheral vascular examination. Choose the correct among the following values reflecting a normal ankle–brachial pressure index?
questions.correct_answer: D. Greater than or equal to 1.0

questions.text: All of the following indicator can be used to measure ECF Volume, EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
Indicators used in measurement of body fluids
1.Total body water (TBW)
  • Deuterium (D2O)
  • Tritium (3H2O)
  • Antipyrine
  • Aminopyrine
2. ECF volume:

Non metabolizable saccharides are used

  • Inulin (best)
  • Sucrose
  • Mannitol
  • Sodium thiosulphate and Sodium thiocyanate are also used.
3. ICF volume

(TBW - ECF)

can't be measured directly
4. Plasma volume

Iodine 125 labelled albumin

Evans’ blue(T1824)
5. Red cell volume Tagging with 51Cr, Fe-59, 32P
6. Interstitial fluid (ECF - plasma volume)

questions.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation for the quick diagnosis of an aortic dissection?
Muscle spindle function is?

options.label: A
options.text: Detects the dynamic change in muscle length

questions.correct_answer: A. Detects the dynamic change in muscle length
questions.explanation:
Muscle spindle Golgi tendon organ
  • Situated in belly or muscle
  • Formed byintra-fusal fibres
  • Detects the length of muscle when muscle is stationary
  • Detect rate of change of length
  • Present in tendon
  • Made up of tendon fibres
  • Detects the muscle tension.
  • Detects rate of change of tension.

questions.text: Regarding the epidemiology of hypertension, all the following statemnts are true EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: In individuals 60 years or older, average systolic blood pressure is higher in women.

options.label: B
options.text: Diastolic blood pressure increases steadily with age.

options.label: C
options.text: Hypertension prevalence is lower in Dravidians than Caucasians.

options.label: D
options.text: Blood pressure increases steadily during the first two decades of life, in developed nations.

questions.correct_answer: B. Diastolic blood pressure increases steadily with age.

questions.text: An asthma patient is brought to the ER with status asthmaticus. All of the following pathologic findings are likely to be seen in this person EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Infiltration of the airway mucosa with eosinophils and neutrophils

options.label: B
options.text: Infiltration of the alveolar spaces with eosinophils and activated T lymphocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Occlusion of the airway lumen by mucous plugs

options.label: D
options.text: Thickening and edema of the airway wall

questions.correct_answer: A. Infiltration of the airway mucosa with eosinophils and neutrophils

questions.text: All are true about Bainbridge reflex, EXCEPT ?
AKI evaluation in a patient, who has recently undergone a cardiopulmonary bypass, which of the following urine microscopy findings suggests cholesterol emboli, as the source of renal failure?
All of the following are true about Decerebrate rigidity except:-

options.label: A
options.text: Extension of both upper and lower extremity

options.label: B
options.text: Flexion of upper extremity and extension of lower extremity

options.label: D
options.text: Reticulo spinal tract is also involved

questions.correct_answer: B. Flexion of upper extremity and extension of lower extremity

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding alcoholic liver disease are true EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Fatty liver is present in > 90% of daily and binge drinkers.

options.label: B
options.text: Hepatitis C infection: worsens alcoholic liver disease prognosis.

options.label: C
options.text: More than 50% of alcoholics will develop alcoholic hepatitis.

options.label: D
options.text: The pathologic hallmarks of alcoholic liver disease are fatty liver, hepatitis, and cirrhosis.

questions.correct_answer: C. More than 50% of alcoholics will develop alcoholic hepatitis.

questions.text: Which of the following enzyme is facilitated by colipase ?
A patient, with episodic abdominal pain and stress-induced edema of the tongue, lips and larynx is likely to have low functional or absolute levels of which of the following proteins?
Which of the following reflex stretches the walls of heart chamber that results in contraction of cardiac muscle with increased force ?
Which one of the following joints is most often spared by osteoarthritis?
All of the following hormone uses the receptor tyrosine kinase, except ?
After the neurosurgical resection of a pituitary tumor, which of the following mentioned adrenal gland function will be preserved post-operatively?

options.label: A
options.text: Na+ retention, in response to hypovolemia

options.label: B
options.text: Cortisol release, as a stress response

options.label: C
options.text: Morning peak of plasma cortisol level

questions.correct_answer: A. Na+ retention, in response to hypovolemia

questions.text: True about Bowditch’s effect ?
questions.correct_answer: D. Increase in HR increases contraction

questions.text: Best candidate, with Parkinson's disease, for deep brain stimulation is which one of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: 62 year old woman on levodopa-carbidopa, with episodes of freezing while walking

options.label: B
options.text: 69 year old man, with orthostatic hypotension and recurrent falls

options.label: C
options.text: 72 year old woman; unresponsive to dopaminergic therapy and with severe tremor

options.label: D
options.text: 75 year old man; with worsening dementia symptoms

questions.correct_answer: C. 72 year old woman; unresponsive to dopaminergic therapy and with severe tremor

questions.text: Plateau phase of cardiac action potential :

A woman, 12 weeks pregnant with her first child, has an abnormal finding on a CBC. She is asymptomatic, and has no family history of significant anemias. Hb: 12.1 g/dL, hematocrit: 38%, MCV: 60 fL, MCH: 25 pg, ferritin: 50 μg/L, iron: 15 μmol/L. On a PBS, what is the most characteristic finding expected?

During the course of psychotherapy the patient said to therapist that he gets sexual arousal by physical suffering or injury inflicted on him by others. The given condition is ?
A 23 year old female was brought to hospital on 4th day post delivery. Guardians stated that the patient seemed very irritable and sad for past 2 days.
Match the EEG recordings A) Stage 1 1) Sleep spindles B) Stage 2 2) Alpha wave C) Stage 4 3) Theta wave D) Awake 4) Delta wave
questions.explanation:
Awake Alpha wave
Stage 1 Theta wave
Stage 2 Sleep spindles, K complexes
Stage 3 Appearance of Delta wave
Stage 4 Predominance of delta wave

questions.text: A 21 year old male was brought to hospital with the history of using heroin and stopped using for past 2 days. What is unlikely to be seen ?

A 13 year boy was brought to hospital with an incised wound. On examination wound is clean and uninflected. In the process of healing by 1st intention ( primary union) when will the new collagen fibrils start forming?
questions.explanation:
Day 00 Blood clot
Day 01 Blood clot + Neutrophilic infiltration
Day 02 Day 01 + thin epithelial layer
Day 03 Granulation tissue ( macrophages, fibrous tissues, angiogenesis)
Day 04/05 GT + collagen deposition ( typeIII)
Day 14 high collagen deposition + fibrous tissue

questions.text: A 34 years male underwent a renal transplantation surgery. Half and hour after the procedure their was Graf rejection. Which type of hypersensitivity reaction is this?

A 22 year female came with the complains of lower abdominal pain and diarrhea for past 2 days. Histopathology finding are show in the image given below. The following statements are true regarding the causative agent except

options.label: A
options.text: Active adult form ( trophozoites) are seen in tissues and diarrheal stool

options.label: B
options.text: Cystic form is seen only in formed stools

options.label: C
options.text: Trophozoite and cyst are passed in stools

options.label: D
options.text: Trophozoites are the infectious stage of the parasite and are found in contaminated food and water

questions.correct_answer: D. Trophozoites are the infectious stage of the parasite and are found in contaminated food and water

questions.text: A 38 year male came to hospital with the complaint of diarrhea ( watery and mucoid ) 4 times a day for past 3 days . He gave history of antibiotic use. What is the causative agent for this condition?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Acetylcholinesterase is absent , Calretinin is highly expressed

options.label: C
options.text: Both Acetylcholinesterase and Calretinin are highly expressed

questions.correct_answer: A. Acetylcholinesterase is highly expressed, Calretinin is absent

Normal Hirschsprung disease
AchE - Highly expressed
calretinin + -

questions.correct_answer: D. prosopagnosia - bilateral frontal lobe lesion

questions.text: Which of the following features distinguishes optic disc swelling from papilloedema?

options.label: A
options.text: The presence of relative afferent pupillary defect

options.label: D
options.text: Leakage of fluorescein from the optic nerve head during fluorescein angiography

questions.correct_answer: A. The presence of relative afferent pupillary defect

questions.text: In a 35 year old female patient presenting with headache and papilloedema, a CT scan displayed normal ventricles. Which one of the following is the most likely provisional diagnosis in such a patient?
A patient with a diagnosed optic chiasmic lesion would have any of the following visual defects, except?

In a patient with myopia of 0.5D from a distance of 1 meter, when performing retinoscopy, where will the reflex move?

options.label: A
options.text: The reflex will move opposite to the mirror

options.label: B
options.text: The reflex will move with the mirror

options.label: C
options.text: The reflex may move on either side

options.label: D
options.text: There will be no movement of the reflex

questions.correct_answer: B. The reflex will move with the mirror

questions.text: A 28 day old neonate presented to the ER with jaundice. Serum bilirubin: 4.2 mg/dL, abdomen USG: gallbladder is shrunken, extrahepatic ducts not seen. Which is the best initial management in this infant?

A man is newly diagnosed with a squamous cell carcinoma thought to be of the internal jugular lymph node chain on the right side. CT, MRI head and neck: negative for a primary malignancy. Select the next appropriate step in the assessment of this patient.

options.text: Selective sampling of cervical lymph nodes

options.label: D
options.text: Neck ultrasound: thyroid and bilateral cervical lymph nodes

questions.text: CT head scan: 32-year-old female, B/L frontal lobe contusions. She has a GCS of 5. Best initial management of this patient is:

options.label: B
options.text: Observation with anticonvulsive medication administration for 7 days

questions.text: A 67-year-old man receives 3 units of packed red blood cells during a particularly difficult surgery. He is bleeding heavily from his perineal surgical wound, 4 hours later. Lab values: normal prothrombin, partial thromboplastin, and bleeding times, non-elevated fibrin degradation products, serum fibrinogen content: reduced and platelet count is 75,000/μL. Most likely cause of bleeding in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Blood vessel bleed in the surgical region

questions.correct_answer: B. Blood vessel bleed in the surgical region

questions.text: After an uneventful laparoscopic cholecystectomy, a 49 year old woman receives 1 dose of cephalosporin. She returns to the ER with fever, nausea, and copious diarrhea, after a week, and is suspected of having pseudomembranous colitis. Patient is afebrile, with no peritoneal signs on abdominal examination, mild left-shift leukocytosis. Most appropriate initial management?

A toddler, 3-year-old, is diagnosed with a chemical burn after spilling bleach on his lower extremities. His clothing is removed and resuscitation is administered. Which is the most appropriate initial management along with these measures?

options.label: B
options.text: Neutralization of burn wound with weak acids.

options.label: C
options.text: Lavage of burn wound with large volumes of water.

questions.correct_answer: C. Lavage of burn wound with large volumes of water.

On examination, weak pulses palpable distal to the injury, inability to move foot. Most appropriate initial management of this patient is which one of the following?
A patient with a 50-year history of cigarette smoking presents with a nontender, hard mass in lateral neck. Best diagnostic test to establish malignancy diagnosis is?

A 52-year-old woman presents with hypertension, obesity, and new skin striae. You are concerned about possible Cushing syndrome. Which of the following is the most common cause of Cushing syndrome?

A college student, with a bulge in his right groin, notices that it is accentuated with coughing, but is easily reducible. Which of the following hernias has the path of the spermatic cord within the cremaster muscle?

questions.text: Match the individual actions of interleukins A) IL-6 1) Normal functioning of B/T cell (defect causes SCID) B) IL-7 2) Secreted by T cells, responsible for recruitment of neutrophils (eg; in hepatitis) C) IL-10 3) Systemic effects of inflammation D) IL-17 4) Anti inflammatory action
questions.explanation:
IL 1 Systemic effects of inflammation
IL 2 Autocrine action; increases T lymphocytes
IL 4 B cell proliferation & differentiation
IL 5 B cell proliferation & differentiation
IL 6 Systemic effects of inflammation
IL 7 Normal functioning of B/T cell (defect causes SCID)
IL 11 Increases platelets
IL 3 Haematopoietic precursor cell proliferation
IL 10 Anti inflammatory action
IL 17 Secreted by T cells, responsible for recruitment of neutrophils (eg; in hepatitis, kaposis sarcoma)

questions.text: A previously healthy 20-year-old man presents to the ER with sudden onset of left-sided chest pain. ECG: normal, CXR: 40% left pneumothorax. Which of the following procedures is considered appropriate treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: Serum copper levels may vary upon the stage of disease

questions.text: A 43-year-old woman presents with dysphagia, regurgitation of undigested food, and weight loss. Upper endoscopy shows no evidence of malignancy, esophageal motility studies: incomplete lower esophageal sphincter relaxation. Next best step in the treatment of this patient?

options.label: A

questions.text: A 64-year-old man presents with Peripheral Artery Occlusive Disease. He has a surgical history of a triple coronary artery bypass 3 years years ago. He is taking only a thiazide diuretic. Which of the following medications is most appropriate to manage this patient’s atherosclerosis?

A 10 year old male was brought to hospital with the complaints of dyspnea, wheezing. He is allergic to crustaceans, dust and pollen. Investigations are done to this patient. Following are the microscopic findings seen in this patient except
match the following A) Breast cancer 1) S-100 B) Pancreatic cancer 2) CA 15.3 C) Stomach cancer 3) CA 19.9 D) Melanoma 4) CA 72.4
questions.explanation:
PSA Prostate cancer
Ig Multiple myeloma
HCG Chorio carcinoma, Germ cell tumor
Calcitonin Medullary thyroid cancer
Catecholamines Neuroblastoma > Pheochromocytoma
CEA Colon cancer, Pancreatic cancer, IBD, Hepatitis, Bronchitis
AFP Hepato cellular cancer, Non seminomatus germ cell tumor, omphalocele, Hepatitis, pregnancy
CA 15.3 Breast cancer
CA 19.9 Pancreatic cancer, Colon cancer
CA 125 Ovarian cancer
NSF, Chromogranin Neuroblastoma, Small cell lung cancer
CA 72.4 Stomach cancer
CA 27.29 Breast cancer
S - 100 Melanoma, Schwannoma, LCH
LDH Lymphoma, Dysgerminoma / seminoma, Ewing’s sarcoma
Beta 2 Microglobulin Multiple myeloma
CD 99 (MiC 2) Ewings sarcoma

questions.text: A 62-year-old man complains of a severe mid-abdominal pain, just two days after admission to the hospital for a MI. Cardiac index: 1.6. There is no peritoneal irritation or distention. Serum lactate: 9 mmol/L (normal: < 3 mmol/L). The most appropriate next step in this patient’s management is which one of the following?

The patient wishes to avoid therapy involving any risk for impotence. Which of the following is the most appropriate management of this patient?

Match principal actions of arachidonic acid metabolites in inflammation A) vasodilation 1) Leukotrienes B4 B) vasoconstriction 2) PGE2 C) increased vascular permeability 3) Thromboxane A2 D) chemotaxis, leukocyte adhesion 4) Leukotrienes E4
questions.explanation:
vasodilation Prostaglandins PGD2, PGI2 , PGE1, PGE2
chemotaxis, leukocyte adhesion HETE ; Leukotrienes B4
increased vascular permeability Leukotrienes C4, D4, E4
vasoconstriction Leukotrienes C4, D4, E4 ; Thromboxane A2

questions.text: A G3P3 patient had a past history of previous second trimester abortion. She presented with 22 weeks of gestation, abdominal pain. USG was taken which revealed funneling of internal os. What is the ideal management for this patient?
All are true about anterior abdominal wall components, EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: Conjoint tendon is formed by 2/3 of external oblique and 1/3 internal oblique

options.label: B
options.text: Inguinal ligament formed by aponeurosis of external oblique

options.label: C
options.text: Lacunar ligament is extension of inguinal ligament

questions.correct_answer: A. Conjoint tendon is formed by 2/3 of external oblique and 1/3 internal oblique

questions.text: Root value for pudendal nerve is?

A pregnant patient presented with fatigue and dizziness during her 2nd trimester. CBC revealed Hb – 10%, with increase reticulocyte count. Serum Iron was also low. You diagnose the case as nutritional anemia secondary to iron deficiency and decide to administer iron supplementation to the patient. Which of the following is a better absorbable oral form of Iron supplement?
Medial cord of brachial plexus involves all of the following nerves, except?

A G1P1 caucasian with a known history of alcohol intake beyond medical advise during prenatal period. After advise during an antenatal visit, she reduced the quantity of drinking only for the last three months of pregnancy. After delivery, which of the following features are needed to diagnose the case as Fetal alcohol syndrome? (I) Small palpebral fissures (II) Rail road track ears (III) Thin vermilion border (IV) Smooth philtrum
Muscles with oblique fibres is,
Nerve supplying the tragus of ear,
questions.explanation:
GREAT AURICULAR NERVE SUPPLIES MOST OF THE CRANIAL SURFACE AND POSTERIOR PART OF THE LATERAL SURFACE INCLUDING HELIX, ANTIHELIX, AND LOBULE.
LESSER OCCIPITAL NERVE UPPER PART OF THE CRANIAL SURFACE OF THE AURICLE
AURICULOTEMPORAL NERVE TRAGUS, CRUS OF HELIX AND ADJOINING AREA OF HELIX
AURICULAR BRANCH OF VAGUS(ARNOLD S NERVE) CONCHA AND EMINENTIA CONCHAE

questions.text: A 25 year old primigravida female presented with amenorrhea for the past two months. Urine pregnancy test was positive. Beta hCG level was very high. At 5 months AOG, during clinical exam, many fetal parts were palpable and the size of the uterus was bigger than the expected size of AOG. Twin twin transfusion syndrome occurs in multiple pregnancy due to deep arteriovenous anastomosis. Which among the following is the most common type where TTTS is more common and the type where this condition can be reversed in, respectively?
General sensation of anterior 2/3 rd of tongue is supplied by
questions.explanation:
Anterior 2/3rd( from 1st arch) Posterior 1/3rd(from 3rd arch ) From the vallecula(from 4th arch)
General sensations ViaLingual nerve Glossopharyngeal nerve Internal laryngealbranch of superior laryngeal nerve (vagus)
Special sensations Except for circumvallate papillae viachorda tympani(facial nerve) Including circumvallate papillaevia the glossopharyngeal nerve Internal laryngealbranch of superior laryngeal nerve (vagus)

questions.text: A 19 year old girl was pregnant but presented with abdominal pain in the third month of antenatal period. On USG, a secondary ovarian ectopic pregnancy was diagnosed. How do you term this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Pregnancy coming out from uterus and settling on ovary

options.label: B
options.text: Pregnancy coming out from tube and settling on ovary

options.label: C
options.text: Pregnancy coming out from ovary after settling on ovary

options.label: D
options.text: Pregnancy coming out from abdomen after settling on ovary

questions.correct_answer: A. Pregnancy coming out from uterus and settling on ovary

questions.text: A 20 year old nulliparous woman was admitted in the delivery room on the expected delivery date. On examination, two babies with cephalic presentation was noted, the cervix was 3 cms open but did not open any further for the past 14 hours. What would be the appropriate management in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Perform Episiotomy and deliver the baby

questions.explanation:
Nullipara Multipara
Prolonged latent phase >20hrs >14hrs
Active phase disorders
Protracted dilatation <1.2cm/hr <1.5cm/hr
Protracted descent <1cm/hr <2cm/hr

Nulliparous Mean - 9 Hours Upper - limit 18.5hrs
Multiparous Mean - 6 hours Upper - limit 13.5hrs

questions.text: Foramen magnum transmits ?
All of the following structures are transmitted via foramen spinosum, EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: Meningeal branch of the mandibular nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Superior ophthalmic vein from the cavernous sinus

questions.correct_answer: C. Superior ophthalmic vein from the cavernous sinus

questions.text: Following are derivatives of dorsal mesogastrium, except :-
questions.explanation:
Structures derived from ventral mesogastrium:-
  • Liver
  • Ventral pancreatic bud
  • Right and Left triangular ligaments
  • Coronary ligaments of liver
  • Falciform ligament of liver
  • Lesser omentum

Structures derived from dorsal mesogastrium:

  • Spleen
  • Dorsal pancreatic bud
  • Gastrophrenic ligament
  • Gastrosplenic ligament
  • Leinorenal ligament
  • Greater omentum

questions.text: USG of a 35 years old gravida patient revealed small grape like cystic structures without the evidence of a developing embryo. A diagnosis of a complete mole will most likely reveal which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Genotype of the mole is a 46XXX and is completely paternal in origin

options.label: B
options.text: Genotype of the mole is triploid

options.label: D
options.text: Serum levels of alpha-fetoprotein are elevated

questions.correct_answer: A. Genotype of the mole is a 46XXX and is completely paternal in origin
questions.explanation:
Important Features of complete and partial moles
Features Complete mole Partial mole
Embryo/feus Absent Present
Hydropic degeneration of villi Pronounced and diffused Variable and focal
Trophoblast hyperplasia Diffuse Focal
Uterine size More than the date (30-60%) Less than the date
Theca lutein cysts Common (25-50%) Uncommon
Karyotype 46 XX (85%) paternal in origin Triploid (90%) diploid (10%)
ß hCG High (> 50,000) Slight elevation (<50,000)
Classical clinical symptoms Common Rare
Risk of Persistent (GTD) 20% <5%

questions.text: A 28 year old primigravida delivered a term baby via normal vaginal spontaneous delivery. During puerperium, the lochia seen per vagina is in which of the following sequences?

options.label: A
options.text: Lochia alba, Lochia serosa, Lochia rubra

options.label: B
options.text: Lochia serosa, Lochia rubra, Lochia alba

options.label: C
options.text: Lochia alba, Lochia rubra, Lochia serosa

options.label: D
options.text: Lochia rubra, Lochia serosa, Lochia alba

questions.correct_answer: D. Lochia rubra, Lochia serosa, Lochia alba

questions.text: An 18 year old female complains of pain in the pelvis every month. Upon evaluation, it was noted that the pain was due to collection of blood and debris in the pouch of Douglas at the time of ovulation. What is the diagnosis?

  • Soft palate

  • Uvula
  • Hard palate
  • Soft palate
  • Hard palate only

questions.text: A 30 year old nulliparous female presented with painful menstruation and painful sexual intercourse. Past history revealed two abortions at 8 and 12 weeks of gestation. CA 125 was increased. USG showed chocolate cyst of ovary. The patient was managed medically with an injection of DMPA and Danazol tablet. What is the first sign to stop Danazol intake?
A 50 year old postmenopausal female on hormone replacement therapy presented with irregular acyclical bleeding. What is the first thing to do in this patient?
Human Papilloma virus is the most common cause of cervical cancer. Inorder to diagnose it early, screening for HPV is done. All of the following people fall under the screening criteria, except?

options.label: A
options.text: A 20 year old sexually active woman who had her 1st intercourse at the age of 18

options.label: B
options.text: A 25 year old woman afraid of cervical cancer after reading an article about it

options.label: C
options.text: A 30 year old woman with single negative Co-test result

options.label: D
options.text: A 65 year old female with single negative Co-test result

questions.correct_answer: A. A 20 year old sexually active woman who had her 1st intercourse at the age of 18

questions.text: An infant is to undergo a surgical procedure. How many hours before the procedure breast feeding should be stopped?

N2O cylinder Blue 3, 5

questions.text: A 9-year-old was brought to hospital for circumcision. Physician applied EMLA cream on skin surface for surface anesthesia. Following statement are true regarding EMLA cream except

questions.correct_answer: B. It has a combination of lignocaine + prilocaine with 0.5% concentration each

questions.text: An 8 year old boy presented with pubertal features. During regular check-up, he was diagnosed precocious puberty and several workups were done. It was noted that the patient had deficiency of 21 hydroxylase enzyme. What is the condition present in this patient?

questions.text: A couple married for 5 years could not have a child. They were both tested. Semen analysis of the male partner turns out to be normal. Which of the following is not true regarding ovulation test in the female partner?

Rate Limiting Enzymes reversible
1. Citrate synthase 1. Citrate Synthase (A)

3. Iso citrate Dehydrogenase

DEHYDROGENESES

questions.text: Long chain fatty acid is transported into inner mitochondrial membrane by which of the following mechanism?
All of the amino acids can form as an intermediate of TCA cycle, except which of the following?
An autosomal recessive condition in a 15 year old boy, diagnosed with deficiency of biotinidase. Which is of the following clinical feature is less possible to be seen in this patient?
Energy is produced in different forms in different organs. During starvation, what is the fuel used by liver to generate energy?
questions.explanation:
SUBSTRATES UTILIZED FOR ENERGY PRODUCTION
FED FASTING STARVATION
BRAIN Glucose Glucose Ketone Bodies
HEART Fatty Acids Fatty Acids Ketone Bodies
LIVER Glucose Fatty Acids Amino Acids
MUSCLE Glucose Fatty Acids Fatty Acids and KB
ADIPOSE TISSUE Glucose Fatty Acids FA
RBC Glucose Glucose Glucose

questions.text: A 15 year old boy presented with increased uric acid levels. Additional history revealed attempts of self mutilation due to increased levels of phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate. What is the partial deficiency of HGPRT known as?
Anaerobic glycolysis occurs in conditions where oxygen is not present. It is wastage of glucose. Which of the following defines Warburg effect correctly?

options.label: A
options.text: In the presence of oxygen, anaerobic glycolysis is inhibited in yeast cells

options.label: B
options.text: Oxygen consumption by yeast cell falls when supply is kept constant and glucose concentration is increased

options.label: C
options.text: Oxygen consumption by cancer cell falls when supply is kept constant and glucose concentration is increased

options.label: D
options.text: In the presence of oxygen, anaerobic glycolysis is inhibited in cancer cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Oxygen consumption by cancer cell falls when supply is kept constant and glucose concentration is increased
questions.explanation:
PASTEUR EFFECT CRABREE EFFECT
  • In aerobic conditions, glucose consumption Decreases

Or

  • In the presence of O2, anaerobic glucolysis is Inhibited
  • If glucose increases, then O2 consumption falls

or

  • When O2 supply is kept constant & glucose concentration is increased, then the O2consumption by cell falls

questions.text: A primigravida diabetic female delivered a post term large for gestational age baby. It turned to be a case of a severe postpartum hemorrhage and an emergency hysterectomy was done after getting consent from the patient and the patient was discharged. After 2 weeks, the patient complained of urinary incontinence. Which of the following procedure offers best result in this patient?
questions.explanation:
SHIRODKAR SLING →

KHANNA’S SLING →

PURANDARE’S SLING →

Tie to anterior longitudinal ligament

Tie to anterior superior iliac spine

Rectus sheath

questions.text: An athlete is ready for a 100 metres dash. After the gunshot, he starts to run fast. The energy to his muscles is provided by which of the following fuel?
questions.explanation:
Muscle energy systems Power (Rate of ATP production) Capacity (Total ATP produced) Fuel uses
Phosphagen system Very high Very low Creatine: Phosphate or Phospho- creatine
Anaerobic system/ Lactate system High Low Muscle glycogen
Aerobic system/ mito-chondrial respiratoin Low Very high Muscle glycogen, blood glucose, adipose tissue and intramuscular fat

questions.text: A female after giving birth to three children decided to undergo tubectomy procedure. What is the most commonly performed technique for tubectomy?
Enzymes using metals as cofactor are known as metal activated enzymes. All of the following enzymes require Copper as a co factor, except?
Regarding multiple dosing, all of the following statements are true, except:

options.text: Little drug accumulation occurs if the dosing interval is greater than t1/2

options.label: B
options.text: 50% of steady state concentration takes 5 t1/2 to reach

options.label: C
options.text: Dosing interval should increase when giving gentamicin in a patient with renal impairment

options.label: D
options.text: Bolus loading dose reduces the time taken to reach steady state

questions.correct_answer: B. 50% of steady state concentration takes 5 t1/2 to reach

questions.text: All of the following are true about the properties of Diazepam, except:

options.label: C
options.text: Stops acute dystonia caused by metoclopramide

questions.text: Lab tests conducted by the local health department are positive for chronic lead exposure in a child. Lead levels are significantly elevated in a child, but the patient is only mildly symptomatic. The most appropriate antidote for reducing this child’s body load of excessive lead is which one of the following?
After receiving a rapid IV injection of a drug, a patient develops hypocalcemic tetany. What is the most likely cause?
A kidney transplant patient is started on cyclosporine to reduce the risk of graft rejection. Which one of the following is the most common adverse reaction associated with this medication?
questions.correct_answer: C. Nephrotoxicity and risk of infection

questions.text: A previously healthy child developed bacterial meningitis. Supposing there are no specific contraindications, which one of the following is the DOC?

A patient presented to the OPD with complaints of a vulval itch. The urinary hanging-drop examination of revealed trichomonads. Which one of the following is the most appropriate treatment for trichomoniasis?

A patient is taken to the ER after taking an overdose of her levothyroxine medication in a possible suicide attempt. Which of the following drugs would be administered first for immediate control of the hormonal effects of levothyroxine?
A patient, at high risk of postmenopausal osteoporosis, has been started on alendronate. Which of the following is this bisphosphonate’s mechanism of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Direct formation of hydroxyapatite crystals in the bone

options.label: C
options.text: Reduction of number and activity of osteoclasts in the bone

questions.correct_answer: C. Reduction of number and activity of osteoclasts in the bone

Haemoptysis → resembles TB

Calcification → resembles TB

A 30 years old female presented with abdominal pain, nausea, fatigue and dizziness. Further history revealed weight loss of 5 kg in the past 3 months. CBC revealed Hb – 11 gm/dl, MCV – 110 fL and increased reticulocyte count. Stool examination revealed presence of eggs. All of the following is true regarding the cause in this patient, except?

CESTODES TREMATODES NEMATODES
→ Tape like→ Monoecious → Leaf like → Monoecious except Schistosomes (Dioecious) → Cylinderical → Dioecious
→ Suckers with hooks → Suckers without hooks → Have Buccal capsule
→ Absent alimentary canal → Poorly developed alimentary canal → Well developed alimentary canal
→ Body cavity absent → Body cavity absent → Body cavity present

questions.text: Forensic department collected a hair strand from the crime spot. Following features suggest the animal hair except

options.label: D
options.text: Fine and thin hair by appearance

questions.correct_answer: D. Fine and thin hair by appearance

HUMAN HAIR ANIMAL HAIR
APPEARANCE Fine and thin Coarse, thicker
CUTICLE Thin, imbricate Thick, coronal / spinous
CORTEX Wider than medulla Narrower than medulla
MEDULLA Narrow,fragmented, discontinuous Wider, continuous
MEDULLARY INDEX < 0.3 > 0.5
PIGMENT Evenly distributed Densely distributed
ARRANGEMENT Towards cortex Towards medulla
PRECIPITIN TEST Specific for humans Specific for animals

questions.text: Match the fatal dose for the given seeds A) Abrus 1) 5 seeds B) Croton 2) 5 - 10 grams C) Ricinus communis 3) 10 seeds D) Semecarpus anacardium 4) 1 seed

Croton 5 seeds
Ricinus communis 10 seeds
Semecarpus anacardium 5 - 10 grams

questions.text: A 27-year-old female was brought to government hospital for post-mortem examination. Police officer said to the physician that the female died of drowning. Given are the signs of drowning except?

A mentally child is found by his father with an unknown substance in his mouth. He initially had a headache, then there was agitation and confusion. The child had a seizure in the ER, on presentation to the hospital and there was dysrhythmia on the cardiac monitor. ABG analysis shows severe metabolic acidosis. Which of the following agents is most likely cause of his symptoms?

In a child who is immunized completely, a throat swab was collected. It revealed the presence of gram positive rods. The causative agent can have which one of the following properties on further laboratory processing?

options.label: A
options.text: It can grow on Potassium tellurite medium

options.label: B
options.text: It would show a positive Elek’s gel precipitation test

options.label: C
options.text: It can be pathogenic to experimental guinea pigs

options.label: D
options.text: It can produce cytotoxicity in tissue cultures

questions.correct_answer: A. It can grow on Potassium tellurite medium

− Gram staining

Culture on:

- LSS (Loeffler’s Serum Slope)

↓

For early diagnosis (6-8 hrs)

- PTA → Definitive diagnosis best selective media

SCHICK TEST

Determines susceptibility of an individual to diphtheriae

If positive → needs immunization

If negative → already immunized

Neutralization test

Lysogenic Phase Part of Transduction

Lytic Phase [Bacteriophage mediated]

questions.text: Which one of the following is a contraindication tion to breast-feeding?

A farmer presented to the emergency department with complaints of fever and flu like symptoms. On examination, inguinal lymphadenopathy was seen which was painful and also an ulcer in leg. Which of the following stains should be used to detect the suspected bipolar stained causative agent?

The recent death of a 45 year old uncle, from MI, of a 2-month-old baby boy has caused the baby’s parents some concern about his risk of CAD. Which of the following is the most appropriate management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Screening of parents for total cholesterol

options.label: B
options.text: Yearly ECGs are recommended for this patient

options.label: C
options.text: Reduce the infant’s dietary fat by giving him skim milk.

questions.correct_answer: A. Screening of parents for total cholesterol

questions.text: A 32 year-old woman presents to the OPD with a lesion on the extensor surface of the right elbow, 2.4 cm in diameter, raised with a flat top and distinct edge. There is an excess accumulation of stratum cornea over the lesion and multiple smaller lesions also located on extensor surfaces. Which term best describes the primary lesion?

A 60 year old woman with a 6 year history of psoriasis (involving her elbows) has been on topical glucocorticoids and a vitamin D analogue. In the past 9 months, her psoriasis has worsened. She now has developed new lesions on her knees, gluteal regions, and scalp, as well as swelling of her digits with pain and stiffness. There is no systemic infection. All of the following therapies will worsen widespread psoriatic disease EXCEPT:
Which one of the following statements about sunburn is true?

options.label: A
options.text: UV B radiation causes maximum development of sunburn at midday.

options.label: B
options.text: Red haired and fair skinned: have high activity of melanocortin-1 receptor

options.label: C
options.text: UVB: more effective at causing sunburn erythema than UVA

options.label: D
options.text: Lag time from sun exposure to development of visible redness: 1–2 hours.

questions.correct_answer: C. UVB: more effective at causing sunburn erythema than UVA

questions.text: A 50 year old woman is started on glyburide 10mg sustained release tablets OD for type 2 diabetes mellitus. She develops an erythematous rash, after spending an afternoon in the garden. Which of the following features cause a suspicion of photoallergy over phototoxicity?

options.label: B
options.text: Persistent hypersensitivity to light after cessation of drug

questions.text: A 11 month old infant with poor weight gain, persistent cough, has a history of multiple bouts of pneumonitis. The parents gave a history of the child have large, foul-smelling stools for months. Which of the following diagnostic tests are mandated to provide an accurate diagnosis in this patient?

An alert, awake infant with a 3 day history of diarrhea presents to the ER with tachycardia, sunken eyes, loss of elasticity of skin and a depressed fontanelle. Which of the following is the right percentage of dehydration in this patient?

An 87 year old woman with multiple medical comorbidities, sustains a fracture of her humerus. The arm is placed in a sling and a no-operation decision is made. After 3 months, the patient still hasn’t recovered normal limb function. There is also an absence of callus over the fracture site. What is the possible complication in this case?

A patient presents to his GP surgery complaining of a swelling on his wrist. On examination of a patient who presented with a focal swelling on the dorsal aspect of the wrist, it is smooth and non-tender, the overlying skin is normal and has free movement over the mass. However, it appears to be fixed to the tendon. Likely diagnosis is which one of the following?

The parents of a 3year old male child state that the child has cheese-like, white material occurring from his foreskin, and he cannot fully retract the foreskin behind the glans penis. What would be the correct website in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Paraphimosis, child requires a circumcision and topical antibiotics

questions.text: A patient, who is undergoing a detailed neurological exam for sciatica, following signs are elicited: sensory loss over outer calf and dorsum of foot, weakness in dorsiflexion of toes, normal knee reflexes, normal ankle reflexes, painful straight leg raise, normal femoral nerve stretch. At which one of the following levels is the disc protrusion?
Which one, out of the following bone pathologies, is not correctly matched to the most common site at which it occurs?

options.label: A
options.text: Enchondroma – Bones of hands and feet

options.label: D
options.text: Osteosarcoma – Femur, just above the knee

questions.text: In a 7 year old child with repeated episodes of otitis media, there is an uneventful surgical placement of pressure-equalization tubes. She soon develops a fever of 104°F, muscle rigidity and metabolic as well as respiratory acidosis. Which of the following is the explanation for her condition?

Which of the following is a correct statement regarding a situation in which a bat is found in the bedroom of a 5 year old sleeping boy? The family and the patient himself denies any bites or contact with the bat.

options.label: A
options.text: Therapy only if patient has signs of rabies infection.

questions.text: About the spleen, all of the following statements are true, except:

options.label: A
options.text: it lies posterior to the axillary line, adjacent to 9th and 11th ribs.

options.label: B
options.text: On USG, spleen is equal to or less than 14 cm on its longest axis

questions.text: All of the below mentioned statements are true regarding skeletal imaging, except? (a) Phased array surface detection coils improve signal:noise ratio in MRI of bone, joint and soft tissues

options.label: A
options.text: Phased array surface detection coils improve signal:noise ratio in MRI of bone, joint and soft tissues

options.label: B
options.text: Cortical bone and calcification abnormalities are usually not detected by MRI.

options.label: C
options.text: Bone scans using 99mTc MDP are extremely specific.

options.label: D
options.text: Fat fluid level within the suprapatellar bursa: indicates a fracture within the knee joint

questions.correct_answer: C. Bone scans using 99mTc MDP are extremely specific.

questions.text: A 60 year old smoker presents with dyspnea on exertion and has progressively worsened over 10 months. On physical examination, resting O2 saturation: 95%. After walking for 100 meters, his saturation is 83%. He requires oxygenation at 3 L/min to maintain his O2 sats at greater than 90%. Lung examination: diffuse end-inspiratory crackles in both lungs. TLC: 72% predicted, RV: 68% predicted, and diffusing capacity: 60%. CT scan is shown below. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is suspected. What would be the expected surgical pathology finding?
In a patient with assumed granulomatosis with polyangiitis, which of the following lung radiologic findings is least likely to be found?
Which of the following statements is wrong about anomerism?

options.label: A
options.text: Two carbons combine with each other when solution form converts to powder form

options.label: B
options.text: Functional carbon always combines with the second last carbon

options.label: C
options.text: Different H and OH orientation asymmetric functional carbon give rise to anomerism

options.label: D
options.text: C1 is the functional carbon for aldoses and C2 for ketoses

questions.correct_answer: A. Two carbons combine with each other when solution form converts to powder form
